p.s: After summarising the argument that is taking place between Macbeth and Lady Macbeth, it is important to analyse how Lady Macbeth tries to persuade her husband.
For that it is necessary to look at her choice of words including stylistic devices.
During the argument with her husband Lady Macbeth is using many stylistic devices.

For exempleexample in line 16 and 18 where she compares her husband with a coward and in line 18 where she compares the acting of Macbeth with the acting of a cat which wanted fish but would not get her paws wet.
So Macbeth wants to get kingKing of Cawdor but he does not want to kill Duncan.
These both similes that Lady Macbeth uses makesmake the reader clear about the fear of Macbeth and makes the text more understandable for the reader.
With the sentence And, to be more than what you were, you would be so much more the man. (ll. 27-28).
She would motivate Macbeth to kill the present king because then he would be more than he is at that point, so he would be a man then.
In the lines 35 and 36 she uses a simile [...] had I sworn as you have done to this (ll. 35f.).

She says that it is not brave to give up things that have been swear before and that it is important to show the people that you can do this, so that you are able to do this with all your heart and motivation.
This simile highlighthighlights the wish of Lady Macbeth that her husband should not give up his dreams because of his own fear but that he should fight for them.
The antithesis We fail! [...] And we'll not fail (ll. 39-41) shows that Lady Macbeth is hardly trying to persuade her husband.
It shows her own insecurity of the plan and that she also does not know if the plan is a good idea.
In the lines 45 to 46 she uses a metaphor the warder of the brain shall be a fume [...].
With the help of this stylistic device she illustrates a picture so that the reader gets included and havehas to think about it.
It means that Lady Macbeth makes the guarderguard of Duncan so drunk that their brain does not know what is happened it that time.
All in all, Lady Macbeth uses a lot of stylistic devices to emphasize her wish and also her opinion.
All the stylistic devices helpshelp the reader to unterstandunderstand the text and to make it to him more varied and interesting.
